Taj Club House, Chennai, is a nice place to stay. It has clean, well-maintained rooms and friendly staff.

The breakfast buffet was good enough, but I felt the service could have been better. The location is central but a little far from the airport.

Overall, it was a comfortable stay with decent amenities and warm service.

text.text:
I stayed at Taj Club House from 21st to 24th March 2025.  This was one of the best experience I had ever had in any of the hotels, I have visited so far.
Hospitality of the staff at the hotel was amazing.  Staff at the hotel did not say no to any of our requests.
They arranged for medicine for my daughter in the middle of night for my daughter.  And I am really grateful to them for that.
One day for breakfast we needed Jain Sambar and they quickly got that made for us and best part is that they remembered this request even the next day even when the hotel was completely booked.  I just had breakfast at the hotel and it was delicious and satisfying.
We were gifted a nice souvenir on check out.  Unfortunately, my daughter did not get the toy they generally give as a souvenir but they eventually were happy with the souvenir.

A shout out to all the staff members at the hotel. Sadly I do not remember name of all the staff members but Santhiya G, who had been very kind and helpful with checkout formalities.

text.text:
1. We asked for cold water to be brought to our room. No one showed up. So we called the reception 4 times. Every time someone said that they’ve informed the staff and some is bringing it up right now. No one showed up for 30 minutes. 30 minutes later, we get a call and are told that there is no cold water. This could’ve been done initially. But we simply asked for an ice bucket. No one showed up again. Then a staff showed but with regular bottle. We asked him to bring an ice bucket. We were in a hurry. We had to head out: we only delayed our departure because we were waiting for cold water. But we couldn’t delay it anymore. Then the staff assured me that he will bring the ice bucket immediately because I made him aware of the urgency. No one showed up yet again for another 10 minutes. So now we headed out. All we wanted was a bottle of cold water on a hot day because we didn’t have a bottle of water in the fridge in our room.
2. The creamer and coffee was not replenished when the room was cleaned.

All in all the service was poor. For the price that you seek, it’s not worth it at all. I wouldn’t book my stay here again

text.text: I recently had the pleasure of staying at Pullman Chennai, and I must say, it was a truly lovely experience. The hotel's culinary offerings were exceptional, and the hospitality was outstanding. The buffet service was well-organized, and the staff demonstrated a high level of professionalism. I would particularly like to commend Suraj Singh, whose exceptional guest profiling skills and proactive approach significantly enhanced my stay. His ability to anticipate and meet guests' needs was impressive. Overall, I was thoroughly satisfied with my stay and would highly recommend Pullman Chennai to others. Thank you to the entire team for a wonderful experience.

text.text: Oh, I finally slept like a baby after a long time. The hotel’s brilliant lighting makes one feel fresh, unlike many others with dim settings. The first face I met was Dhayaa at the front desk,  a true asset to Pullman. His warm smile, quick check-in under 2 minutes, and thoughtful follow-ups made me feel instantly at home. The buffet meals were sumptuous, with food and service both outstanding. I’m a customer for life — for me, if it’s Chennai, it has to be Pullman.

text.text:
Do not stay here currently - there is very loud construction works going on. Their website discretely mentions this, though says the stop date is the 15th... It's the 17th, and the construction is ongoing. Came here with friends for a wedding.

We honestly would not have stayed here if we'd known it would be this ridiculously loud.

Every day, between 9am and 6pm. Even wearing noise cancelling headphones and with music on you can't get any rest.

They offered us the potential to move rooms, but on the day my partner was unwell and we were checking out the next day anyway. All our friends throughout the hotel had the same issue.

Not good enough for a 5 star hotel.

Other than this, the hotel is lovely. I imagine coming when there's not construction would be a great stay. The staff are wonderful.

text.text:
Taj used to be associated with luxury. Don't get me wrong, the service and the hospitality is still on point. The people are kind and helpful and get things done.

But wow the infrastructure and the hard product is so poor. The rooms are an afterthought. There's no harmony in the design. There's constant drilling sounds during the day. There's an ugly video door phone inside and very basic lighting controls which makes the whole place feel like a cheap budget hotel

Their Ginger hotels which are a budget hotel have some identity to their design. This is a mess.

Get back to the good days, Taj. Its not too late.

text.text:
Our stay at Taj Coromandel was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with warm hospitality that instantly made us feel at home. The staff are highly experienced, attentive, and always ready to go the extra mile to ensure every guest’s comfort. Their professionalism is matched by a genuine warmth that truly sets this hotel apart.

The dining experience was equally remarkable. The breakfast spread offered an impressive variety of dishes, each prepared with exceptional taste and quality. Whether it was authentic local flavors or international favorites, every item was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented.

Taj Coromandel doesn’t just provide accommodation—it delivers a complete experience of luxury, comfort, and care. I would wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone looking for world-class service and unforgettable memories.

text.text: A Pleasant and Hassle-Free Stay I recently spent over 10 nights at Woodlands Inn, Chennai, and had a smooth, comfortable stay throughout. Although the hotel was fully booked, the staff remained exceptionally courteous, prompt, and attentive to every need. Even the housekeeping and support staff were consistently helpful, respectful, and never once showed signs of complaint — a real credit to the hotel's service standards. The rooms are compact but thoughtfully designed, clean, and fully functional — I faced no issues with amenities, bathrooms, or plug points. Special thanks to Mr. Shashikant and Mr. Mohammed, who provided seamless support from the time of booking to check-out. Their professionalism truly stood out. Overall, a well-run hotel offering great service. Highly recommended.

text.text:
I stayed here for 12 days with my family, and overall it was a very positive experience. The staff were extremely warm, respectful, and made us feel right at home. They were friendly and accommodating throughout our stay, and especially helpful with our young child, which we really appreciated.

The rooms were clean, well-maintained, and had a pleasant ambience with good lighting. The bathrooms were also in great condition. While the room size felt a bit small for us — especially when it came to handling our luggage and unpacking day-to-day — it wasn't a major issue, just something to keep in mind if you're staying longer or with kids.

All in all, a comfortable stay with lovely people managing the place. Would definitely recommend for short to medium stays.

text.text: Stayed in hotel Woodlands Inn, Chennai for 4 days. We checked in late at night (almost at 12O'clock). Even then we got a warm reception. The rooms are very neat and clean. The rooms had electric kettle and other amenities. The only thing that I found lacking in the rooms were a wardrobe and a full size mirror. Enjoyed our stay here.

text.text: I was on a business trip....away from home. When I checked in on sat in eve, I was greeted by warm n welcoming smile of Bikram (security) at the entrance. My check in procedure was quick. Rooms are amazing with all amenities one may need. I took tour to the pool. Babesh the swimming coach is so friendly and warm. He spoke about his inspiring experiences. Hotel food is amazing. I preferred the buffer. My attenders sushmita sarita arvind soumik are so caring. They even cut a see you soon cake for me. How heartwarming. They ensure I have what I need and kept checking on me. Everyday while leaving to work, poresh (security) will again greet you with such a positive and Friendly approach. And same was with Bikram when I returned at night. The hotel staff person dhanush even offered me taking treats along when I went to meet my friends. They are so into ensuring they give you options and such a comfortable stay. Chefs are very friendly and smile at you. Chef gopal would make amazing soft rotis for me. Head chef nisarg is super warm n made me handmade icecream...so yummy. My check out was great. devashish gazal mina Lalitha took a picture and also gave me some good bye treats. All in all it felt like a home away from home. ❤️

Staying in Novotel Chennai was an amazing and excellent.
I had a wonderful experience at your restaurant. The service was attentive, polite, and timely without ever feeling rushed. The staff (Aman) made sure we were comfortable throughout the meal and anticipated our needs, from refilling water glasses to checking in at the right moments. They were friendly, knowledgeable about the menu, and gave excellent recommendations. Overall, the service truly enhanced the dining experience and made it memorable. Thank you for such warm hospitality—I look forward to visiting again soon!

text.text:
Elegant Property, Excellent Staff — But Buffet Dinner Was a Total Letdown

Stayed at Park Hyatt Chennai and while much of the experience was pleasant, there were a few key disappointments.

The staff was superb — warm, welcoming, and highly professional.

Check-in and check-out were smooth and efficient.

Rooms are spacious and comfortable, but could definitely use better lighting, especially in the evenings.

Concierge and front desk took unusually long to respond to calls — phones kept ringing without an answer.

The biggest letdown: buffet dinner was shockingly poor for the price charged. The spread was very limited, especially for a luxury hotel. 0/5 for this — completely not worth the premium rate.

Additionally, they even charged for a 4-year-old child, which felt unreasonable.

Aside from the buffet disappointment, the property is well-maintained, and most services were on point. But for a hotel of this caliber, such a poor dinner spread was unexpected and dampened the experience.

text.text:
good hotel review should be descriptive and informative, painting a clear picture of the experience while also highlighting what makes the hotel unique. It should cover the location, amenities, rooms, service, and overall experience. Reviews should be concise, well-written, and provide details that would be helpful to other travelers.

Here's a more detailed breakdown of what to include in a hotel review:

1. Location and Accessibility:

Note the proximity to attractions, transportation hubs (like train stations or airports), and local amenities.

Mention the ease of getting around from the hotel.

If the hotel offers airport transfers, mention that as well.

2. Rooms and Amenities:

Describe the room's cleanliness, size, and overall comfort.

Mention the quality of the bed and bathroom.

Highlight any unique amenities like a great shower or comfortable bed.

If you have any specific room recommendations, such as staying above the ground floor for better privacy, share that.

3. Service and Staff:

Comment on the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff.

Mention any particularly positive interactions with staff members.

If the hotel offers excellent service, be sure to mention that.

4. Food and Dining:

If the hotel has a restaurant, mention the quality of the food and whether it offers good value for money.

If the hotel offers a breakfast spread, mention the options available.

5. Overall Experience:

Provide an overall assessment of the hotel's value for money.

Mention whether you would recommend the hotel to others and if you would consider staying there again.

If the hotel offers a unique experience, make sure to highlight it.

6. Things to Consider:

Be honest and objective in your review.

Focus on the aspects of your stay that were particularly good or bad.

Provide constructive feedback that can help the hotel improve.

Be concise and to the point, while still being descriptive.

text.text: Rooms are well furnished at 5* level. Decor is classy and elegant. Food in the restaurants is great especially flying elephant  - though the omelette i was ordering for myself for breakfast, was inconsistent across the 3 days I had. Room service order on one night was incorrect- got a veg pad Thai instead of a prawn one. And when I mentioned it, there wasn't any reaction or apology which was weird. I think it lacks these finer aspects of service. I felt the room had a strong room freshener smell and I was personally unable to sleep well ( felt either too hot or too warm in the room). But will i come back, definitely yes - great value for what it offers among it's peers.

text.text:
I had the pleasure of visiting The Pride Hotel, Chennai yesterday, and I must say the experience was absolutely phenomenal! From the moment we stepped in, the hospitality was top-notch & every member of the staff made us feel incredibly welcome.

A special shout out to the Food and Beverage team their service was nothing short of outstanding. They were attentive, friendly & went above and beyond to ensure we had a memorable dining experience.

We were lucky to catch the final day of a truly amazing food festival. The variety, flavors, and presentation of the dishes were simply outstanding! It’s unfortunate that it was the last day, because I would’ve loved to return for more.

The hotel features both a rooftop restaurant with a beautiful ambiance and a stylish ground floor restaurant, both serving delicious food & offering fantastic service. Whether you’re a guest at the hotel or just stopping by for a meal, I highly recommend dining at either location.

Kudos to the entire team at The Pride Hotel for creating such a wonderful atmosphere and delivering excellence at every level. We’ll definitely be back!

text.text:
We are from TCL - TATA Communications Ltd, Chennai. We recently (25-07-2025) hosted a Cocktail Party in Pavilion Hall at Hotel Pride Chennai, and the entire experience was exceptional from start to finish!

The venue was beautifully maintained, clean, and perfectly arranged. From the welcome drink and starters to the main course, every item on the menu was absolutely delicious—our guests were truly impressed. The bar counter setup was elegant and well-organized, adding a classy touch to the event.

A special mention to the F&B Manager Mr.Jyothi Sankar & team for serving everything with such warmth and a smile—their hospitality really stood out and created a wonderful atmosphere.

Heartfelt thanks to the F&B Manager and the Master Chef Mr.Ganesh & Mr.Sudeep for the excellent planning, execution, and flavors. Also, sincere appreciation to the Front Office Manager Mr.Alex and team for warmly receiving guests and guiding them smoothly to the event space.

Thanks as well to the Security team for efficiently managing the parking area, and to the Housekeeping manager Mr.Sridhar & team for keeping the venue spotless throughout.

Highly recommend Hotel Pride, Chennai for any Corporate Cocktail Party/Event—professional service, top-quality food, and a team that truly cares about delivering a great experience.

I had a wonderful experience staying at Pride Hotel in Chennai. From the moment I checked in, the staff was courteous, welcoming, and helpful. The room was clean, well maintained, and offered all the modern amenities I needed for a comfortable stay.

The location is very convenient close to the metro and key parts of the city. I especially appreciated the breakfast buffet, which had a wide variety of delicious South Indian and continental options.

But the service throughout was  average Whether it was housekeeping, front desk, or room service, everyone was a little  less attentive
Overall, I had a relaxing and pleasant stay. I would definitely recommend Pride Hotel to anyone visiting Chennai, whether for business or leisure

Location: Conveniently close to T. Nagar shopping areas – perfect for those who plan to spend most of their time shopping nearby.

Rooms: The property feels like apartments converted into a hotel. The space is adequate for a budget stay. However, the walls and ceiling show signs of age and moisture, which require the owner’s attention.

Cleanliness & Maintenance: Initially, I was given a used room with unchanged bed linen. After requesting a change, a new room was provided, but the floor was still not cleaned properly.

Overall, the location is excellent for shopping trips, but cleanliness and maintenance standards need improvement.

text.text:
I stayed at this hotel recently and honestly, it was not a pleasant experience. The rooms were very small and felt quite suffocating. There was barely enough space to move or keep luggage comfortably. The most disappointing part was the condition of the floors — they were sticky and felt unclean, which made it very uncomfortable to walk around, even with slippers.

Housekeeping was just average, but the cleaning felt rushed and not thorough. Basic cleanliness and hygiene should be a priority, especially in hospitality, but it was clearly lacking here.

The room also had a weird damp smell that didn’t go away, and the overall ambiance was dull. The photos online were quite misleading compared to what was actually offered. Even the bed linens didn’t feel fresh or properly washed.

Honestly, I wouldn’t recommend this place unless the management takes serious steps to improve hygiene and overall upkeep.

text.text:
I had a wonderful experience staying at The Grand One Hotel. The location is extremely convenient, especially for those visiting Apollo Hospital, as it’s just a short walk away. The rooms were spotlessly clean, well-maintained, and equipped with all the basic amenities needed for a comfortable stay.

What truly stood out was the hospitality of the staff—they were polite, helpful, and always ready to assist with a smile. The check-in process was smooth, and housekeeping was prompt and efficient. Even though the hotel doesn’t have an in-house restaurant, room service was available and there were plenty of dining options nearby.

The hotel also offers free Wi-Fi, 24-hour front desk support, and ample parking space, which added to the convenience. I would highly recommend The Grand One to anyone looking for a clean, budget-friendly, and centrally located stay in Chennai.

text.text:
We had the pleasure of staying at Grand One Tower – a true Business Class Hotel in Chennai – not just once, but three times last year, and every time felt like a home away from home.

Their 24×7 check-in and check-out facility is a huge advantage, especially for travellers with unpredictable schedules. But what made our experience truly memorable was the warmth, efficiency, and attentiveness of the entire team.

Special thanks to Mr. Zakariya at the reception – always professional, welcoming, kind and very helpful. And a big appreciation for Juel from housekeeping – always polite and ready to assist. He always promptly brought our online food orders to the room with a smile – truly commendable service.

We opted for a room with a kitchen, which made our stay even more convenient. The kitchen had almost all the basic utensils – even a Mortar and Pestle (Hamandista), which was a thoughtful addition. However, one thing that was missing was a Vessel Holder (Sarashi). Including that would make the kitchen setup even more complete.

In the room all basic amenities were well provided, and the daily housekeeping service kept everything clean and comfortable. We especially appreciated that anything we needed was just a phone call away – the reception team responded immediately.

We noticed that only on some floors had the refrigerator outside at one corner of the floor. So, we specifically chose our room based on the fridge placement and the staff kindly accommodated our preferences.

A small suggestion: the bathroom tiles in the shower area get a bit slippery when wet, although it’s limited to just that section and not the entire bathroom. It would be great if this could be addressed to enhance safety.
Also, the exhaust fan feels slightly underpowered for the bathroom size.

Even though this is a late review, the hospitality and comfort we experienced are still fresh in our minds. We’re already planning to stay at Grand One Tower again on our next visit to Chennai.

A well-managed, peaceful and guest-friendly Business Class Hotel – highly recommended!

text.text:
Disappointment and a ruined evening — we do not recommend this hotel

This hotel turned out to be a major disappointment. The nightly rate is even higher than that of the famous The Leela Palace, which naturally sets certain expectations. Unfortunately, the reality was far from what was promised.

Upon arrival, we immediately noticed that the room provided did not match the photos shown on the booking platform. For a price of over 30,000 rupees per night, this is simply unacceptable. The room was half the size advertised, and somehow ended up being twice as expensive. Despite having a confirmed reservation, no suitable alternative was offered.

The service was extremely poor: no valet, very slow response times, and untrained staff who were unable to explain the situation clearly. As a result, we were left without a place to stay late at night, with a child, forced to search for another hotel on our own.

It’s truly unfortunate that a hotel charging such high rates fails to meet even the basic standards of service. We do not recommend staying here if you value comfort, transparency, and respectful treatment.

text.text: I recently stayed at the Somerset greenways in MRC nagar with my family for 10 days. I cannot praise the staff enough for making our stay very peaceful and worry-free. Right from the security staff who took excellent care for my octogenarian dad, and room service that delivered piping hot coffee to our rooms and the excellent brunch service at the broken bridge cafe, this was a 5 star experience for us. We entertained extended family with dinners at the broken bridge restaurant - such excellent quality food and superb service. The location is very easy get to ( there is airport drop off and pick up for a fee) This was our third time staying in this facility and we’ve always had a wonderful experience. This is our home away from home. Thank you Somerset greenways staff.

text.text:
Our stay at Somerset Greenways Chennai was truly wonderful. The room was big, bright, clean, and spacious, with excellent amenities—including a washing machine, fridge, and kitchen supplies—that made our 10-day visit incredibly comfortable. We especially enjoyed the beautiful rooftop pool and cabana areas, which offered a peaceful escape from the summer heat and the bustle of the city below.

The hotel staff were exceptionally kind and attentive. Kumar, our breakfast server, went above and beyond to ensure we enjoyed each meal, sharing insights about the food, his culture, and Indian history—an unexpected and memorable highlight of our trip. The rest of the dining team, including kitchen manager Thangam, were also warm and helpful. Subhendo, the fitness trainer, was always available to assist us with the hot tub, steam room, and sauna, enhancing our wellness experience.

We are truly grateful for the hospitality and care we received and hope to return to Somerset in the future.

Wow – where do I even begin? This stay was absolutely amazing from start to finish! I honestly didn’t expect to feel this comfortable and pampered on a trip.

The room was spotless. Every day it felt like walking into a freshly made space. The attention to detail in the cleaning was next level.

What truly blew me away was the dress washing and ironing service – so professional, fast, and just incredibly helpful. I didn’t have to worry about a thing!

I felt completely taken care of – not like a guest, but like family. 💛
If I could give more than 5 stars, I would! I can’t wait to come back!

I had a very disappointing experience at this hotel. We paid for 3 people, but the room provided was extremely small and could barely accommodate 2. There was only one queen-size bed, and when we asked for extra bedding, they gave only a single mattress without even a bedsheet. The toilet was broken, and the room was not properly cleaned.

The room service was the worst part — every request took almost an hour, which is unacceptable for any hotel. Overall, the service and facilities were far below basic expectations.

This place is completely misleading and feels like a fraud. Please don’t book this hotel — save your money and avoid the hassle.

text.text:
We came to attend a colleague's marriage function and stayed for one night and 2 days.

I can't really comment on  the location. We will get Uber autos to go anywhere, so I'll bump up the rating by 2 ( only if you can ignore the loud noise /music played by locals right at the back of the hotel)

Rooms
Condition:- Pathetic,
Hygiene:' If there's a negative rating, I would give that.
Cleanliness:- No one knows there's space below bed, below table etc  so all the dust from decades can be seen and FELT in the room.
Bathroom :- Has an odor of its own, natural. Now I'll leave the rest for your imagination.
Bed :- Bedsheets have been changed, but all stains can be seen.
We are quite sure it will have bedbugs too, if they can survive in Chennai heat.
Tv :- Only Tamil channels (no complaints here, but it's a point worth noting)
Cupboards :- Automatic opening facility is there. It will automatically open, and you will find it hard to close.

And the best thing I liked was cockroaches.
Yes, we saw them crawling on the walls inside the room.
I mean, it will be a miracle if we don't see cockroaches in such "well" maintained rooms.

Please avoid

I recently stayed at The Kaira Park Hotels and had a truly exceptional experience from start to finish. I was stayed for 40 days. The staff were incredibly welcoming and attentive, making check-in quick easy and very friendly. I was especially impressed by their hospitality and willingness to accommodate requests.

The room was spacious, immaculately clean, and tastefully decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable. Housekeeping maintained the room to a high standard every day.

The amenities were top-notch. I also dined at the in-house restaurant, and both the food and service were excellent — especially the breakfast, which had a wide variety of fresh and delicious options. The hotel also provide laundry services, it good and delivers fast.

The location was ideal, close to shopping areas and major attractions, yet still peaceful enough for a relaxing stay.

Overall, I highly recommend The Kaira Park Hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable, luxurious, and hassle-free stay. I will definitely return on my next visit!

text.text:
A Wonderful & Safe Stay at Kaira Park

I stayed at Kaira Park just yesterday with my aunt and her daughter, in between transit and I genuinely felt the need to share how pleasantly surprised we were with the entire experience.

First of all, the location is fantastic—surrounded by cozy cafes that stay open till late, which was a real treat for us. The area feels alive even at night, and both Uber and Ola were easily available at any time, which made commuting super convenient.

The hospitality stood out the most. As two women traveling with a teen girl, safety and comfort were top priorities for us—and the staff here made sure we felt both. They were kind, respectful, and went out of their way to make our stay easy. Not only did they let us leave our luggage at the reception after checkout, but they also upgraded our room without us even asking. That kind of thoughtful gesture is rare and really speaks to the kind of people they are—genuinely good with the right attitude.

The room itself was lovely—super neat and well-equipped with all modern amenities. It gave the vibe of a newly renovated space—everything looked and felt fresh and clean, which made settling in so easy.

Overall, we left with a warm feeling, and I’d happily recommend Kaira Park to anyone looking for a safe, clean, and thoughtfully run place to stay. Will definitely come back!

I was very disappointed with my stay at this hotel. We had a long stay in this hotel and extended multiple times due to medical  reasons. We stayed in 4 different rooms in the third floor the floor/ rooms is infested with cockroaches, we found insects in the teabag and coffee drawer in one of the rooms.the manager was informed several times. They didn’t change the sheets often only when we requested although we had more than a ten day stay. Cleanliness should be the top priority for any property, but unfortunately this was severely lacking. The bedding and sofas had stains. Some of the staff in the kitchen area handled the bread with their own hand although there were tongs.
This hotel is supposed to be 5-star, but it doesn’t even come close to international standards.
Definitely not worth the money, I would not stay here again. The only reason we stayed because it was not easy to move with a patient and the bed mattress was good.

text.text:
We recently stayed at this hotel in Chennai, and our overall experience was quite pleasant with a few highs and lows. The room was simply superb — we originally booked a Superior Room but were pleasantly surprised when the hotel upgraded us to a Junior Suite at no extra cost. This gesture definitely elevated our stay and gave us a great room experience.

The hotel staff were trendy and professional, but unfortunately, we didn’t feel properly welcomed on arrival. The front desk seemed too caught up in their work to give us the warm hospitality you’d expect from a 5-star property.

Despite being located in a busy part of Chennai, stepping into the hotel felt like entering a completely different atmosphere — calm, elegant, and peaceful.

We had opted for both breakfast and dinner buffet. The breakfast buffet was quite good, offering a decent spread. However, the dinner buffet was disappointing — the taste and variety did not live up to a 5-star standard and definitely needs improvement.

A special mention goes to the swimming pool — it was fantastic, very relaxing, and had thoughtful features that made it a highlight of our stay.

To sum it up: the room and overall hotel services were excellent, especially the complimentary upgrade and pool experience. The welcome experience and food quality, particularly dinner, were the downsides. With better attention to hospitality and culinary refinement, this hotel could truly deliver a top-tier experience.

text.text:
I had a terrible experience at this hotel. The room was filthy, and worst of all, the bed was infested with bed bugs. My companions and I were bitten multiple times, leaving us with itchy and painful marks. We barely got any sleep because of the discomfort.

The toilet was disgusting, there was black mold on the door and at the bottom of the toilet, making it clear that cleanliness is not a priority at this hotel. It was unhygienic and completely unacceptable.

When we reported the bed bug issue to the hotel staff, despite showing clear evidence of the bites, they completely denied that the bed had bed bugs. Instead of properly addressing the issue, their “solution” was to swap the bed with another from a different room, which is beyond unacceptable!

To make things worse, the manager and receptionist were extremely rude and unhelpful, showing no concern for our situation. The manager dismissed our complaint, saying that in his many years there, they had never experienced bed bugs, yet my entire family was covered in bites! The only saving grace was a kind and understanding female staff, but unfortunately, that did not make up for the horrible experience we had.

Avoid this hotel at all costs unless you want to deal with poor hygiene, bed bugs, dirty toilets, and rude staff.

text.text:
I had a pleasant 8-night stay at this hotel and would definitely consider returning. The front office staff were helpful, and the food was tasty and reasonably priced.

While the housekeeping service was consistent initially, it became slower during the last three days—I had to follow up a couple of times to get my room cleaned. They said the laundry person sent the items late. They did clean my room with a friendly smile.  😃  Thanks to Ms Usha.

I made my booking through Agoda. Although my initial room request wasn’t fulfilled on the first day, I was moved to a room with a bigger bed on the second day. It didn’t have a window view, but it was clean, cozy, and comfortable.

The location is excellent—easily accessible autos, walking distance to Pondy Bazaar and the Om Namo Narayana temple, several good vegetarian restaurants, and even a handy sundry shop nearby.

I had an early morning flight, and the hotel reception kindly arranged a cab for me. He went the extra mile by negotiating the fare with the driver to ensure I got a reasonable and fair price for the ride. As the bell boy was not free, the restaurant waiter help me with my baggages.  Truly appreciate all their assistance.  ❤️

text.text:
Ibis is a venture of Novotel which provide executive stays special for business travels.

Likes -
Nice welcome by the team and receptionist Ambika handled our check-in with a warm welcome. Assisted with all details.
Ambiance of the hotel is very good, 10/10 for the cleanliness and aroma.
Neat and clean rooms with good amenities including mini fridge, hair dryer and basic necessities.
Whole staff team is very cooperative.
Nice breakfast buffet with good variety of both veg and non veg dishes with good taste.
Nice wifi speed and a good swimming pool to use.
They also have cricket nets, basketball court, volleyball, gum to spend good time to burn your calories.
Good security system which does not allow to get down at any other floors so no halts on random floors.
Overall a good experience to enjoy in the centre of the city.
Smooth check-out with warm greeting by Khushi.

Dislikes -
Rooms and bathrooms are bit small in size, but good to stay for a single person

editorialSummary.text: Warm rooms & suites in a refined hotel with pan-Asian dining, a 24/7 coffee shop & an outdoor pool.

text.text:
I stayed at the hotel recently and had a decent experience overall. The best part was the helpful and friendly staff. The front desk team, especially Adam and Aditya, were quick to respond and made sure everything went smoothly during my stay. Their service really stood out.

Room service was good, and the food I ordered came on time and tasted nice. The room itself was quiet, which helped me rest well, and the hotel’s location near the metro station made it easy to get around the city.

However, I felt that the room quality and the amenities didn’t match the price I paid. For the cost, I expected better features and a more comfortable setup. The room had the basic things, but it didn’t feel special or worth the high price. Small touches like better toiletries, improved decor, or extra facilities would have made a big difference.

In short, the hotel is in a good location with polite and responsive staff, but it could improve on room quality and amenities to make the stay feel more valuable for the money spent.

text.text:
After my stay at Taj Mahal palace Mumbai couple of years back, I can’t pick anything but Taj.
My stay at Hotel Taj Coromandel in Chennai was truly unforgettable, leaving me with a lasting impression of luxury, comfort, and impeccable service. From the moment I entered the grand lobby, I was greeted with warmth and hospitality, setting the tone for a memorable experience.

The hotel's architecture exuded elegance and sophistication, blending modern amenities seamlessly with traditional Indian aesthetics. The attention to detail was evident in every aspect of the decor, from the opulent furnishings to the exquisite artwork adorning the walls.

The room I stayed in was a haven of tranquility, offering breathtaking views of the city and the grand pool. The plush bedding, luxurious amenities, and thoughtful touches added to the overall feeling of indulgence and relaxation. The attention to cleanliness and hygiene standards was commendable, ensuring a safe and comfortable stay.

The dining options at the hotel were a culinary delight, with a diverse array of cuisines to suit every palate. Whether indulging in authentic Indian delicacies or savoring international fare, each meal was a gastronomic journey to remember. The attentive service and attention to dietary preferences further enhanced the dining experience.

The hotel's facilities were top-notch, ranging from a well-equipped fitness center to a refreshing swimming pool and spa services. Every need was catered to with utmost care and efficiency, thanks to the courteous and attentive staff who went above and beyond to ensure a memorable stay.

Overall, my experience at Hotel Taj Coromandel surpassed all expectations, leaving me longing to return for another luxurious getaway. Whether visiting for business or leisure, I highly recommend this hotel for an unparalleled stay in Chennai.
Lastly, thank you so much for the beautiful handmade souvenir. Speaks of true Tajness.
I am so so so looking forward to visit again.

~Prajkta

text.text:
We had the pleasure of staying at Grand One Tower – a true Business Class Hotel in Chennai – not just once, but three times last year, and every time felt like a home away from home.

Their 24×7 check-in and check-out facility is a huge advantage, especially for travellers with unpredictable schedules. But what made our experience truly memorable was the warmth, efficiency, and attentiveness of the entire team.

Special thanks to Mr. Zakariya at the reception – always professional, welcoming, kind and very helpful. And a big appreciation for Juel from housekeeping – always polite and ready to assist. He always promptly brought our online food orders to the room with a smile – truly commendable service.

We opted for a room with a kitchen, which made our stay even more convenient. The kitchen had almost all the basic utensils – even a Mortar and Pestle (Hamandista), which was a thoughtful addition. However, one thing that was missing was a Vessel Holder (Sarashi). Including that would make the kitchen setup even more complete.

In the room all basic amenities were well provided, and the daily housekeeping service kept everything clean and comfortable. We especially appreciated that anything we needed was just a phone call away – the reception team responded immediately.

We noticed that only on some floors had the refrigerator outside at one corner of the floor. So, we specifically chose our room based on the fridge placement and the staff kindly accommodated our preferences.

A small suggestion: the bathroom tiles in the shower area get a bit slippery when wet, although it’s limited to just that section and not the entire bathroom. It would be great if this could be addressed to enhance safety.
Also, the exhaust fan feels slightly underpowered for the bathroom size.

Even though this is a late review, the hospitality and comfort we experienced are still fresh in our minds. We’re already planning to stay at Grand One Tower again on our next visit to Chennai.

A well-managed, peaceful and guest-friendly Business Class Hotel – highly recommended!

text.text: Welcomhotel Chennai is located in the heart of the city, that is known for enchanting temples, warm people and delicious cuisine. Hotel is good but rooms and corridor are smelly. Beautifully blending the traditional Indian hospitality with the efficiency of modern technology, this upscale hotel provides the convenience and comfort of home with warm and efficient service, making 'Welcomhotel Chennai' truly yours. The hotel was opened on 18th October 1975, marking the entry of ITC Limited - into the hotel business. The hotel is 8 stories high and has 90 rooms, including 5 Executive Suites (with an area of 60-69 sq m). 43 Club rooms (with an area of 46-60 sq m), 26 Superior rooms (with an area of 33-37 sq m) and 16 Deluxe rooms(with an area of 23-27 sq m). Dining & After Hours offers choice of 4 outlets & 1 Chocolate Boutique : "Earthen Oven"- a North Indian specialty restaurant (12:30 PM to 2:45 PM and 7:30 PM to 11:45 PM (Saturday & Sunday) and 6:30 PM to 11:45 PM (Monday to Friday), "WelcomCafe Marina", 24-hour multi-cuisine restaurant, "My Deli" (9 AM TO 8 PM.), serving light snacks, "Durrant’s Bar" (12 PM to 11:45 PM) and "Fabelle" - The Chocolate Boutique (9 AM TO 10 PM). The hotel has the famous banquet halls - "Mandapam" on the 2nd floor & "Sagari" on the 8th floor. The hotel has outdoor swimming pool for resident guests only operational from 7 AM to 7 PM. ITC Hotel Group is now on the Global Distribution System(GDS), with its own private label code - ' IZ'. Pets are not allowed. All guests are required to produce a valid government approved ID (passport, driving license, voter ID) at the time of check-in. Foreign nationals must produce a valid passport & visa.

highlightedText.text: "This is one of the most comfortable and clean hotels in Chennai."

text.text:
Stayed in February 2025 for five days with my family. This is one of the most comfortable and clean hotels in Chennai. The breakfast was excellent, and I appreciated the staff's recommendation to choose a package that included one meal at the hotel—it was very convenient, especially when traveling with elderly parents.

If you are a light sleeper, I suggest requesting a room not facing the road. The only improvement I would like to see is in the bathroom facilities, specifically better water pressure and a lower washing sink.

text.text:
My stay at S Hotel Chennai was truly exceptional! The hospitality was top-notch - the staff were warm, welcoming, and went above and beyond to ensure my comfort.

The food was absolutely delicious! The menu offered a wide range of options, and each dish was expertly prepared and presented.

The hotel's ambiance was modern, sleek, and spotlessly clean. I felt right at home from the moment I checked in.

Overall, I highly recommend S Hotel Chennai for its outstanding hospitality, excellent cuisine, and comfortable accommodations. Can't wait to stay here again!"

text.text:
It was a great trip to chennai while staying at Ramada Plaza.
Starting with a welcome drink during check-in.
The rooms are quite big, neat and clean, high-tech and finally a large window for a great view of Chennai.
Lights are quite lazy in any mode, and can be modified after reviewing by management.
Dinner is preferable on the rooftop, music, cricket, great view and delicious food with non-alcoholic or alcoholic drinks.
There are limited food varieties for dinner.
The swimming pool is quite large, clean and has great views. The only disappointing thing is that the kids were trained during the same when room guests are swimming, which made me somewhere it can be changed as trainers are arguing for floats. Timing for kids and guests can be modified accordingly by management to have better comfort for guests.
The breakfast is served in various types. It is very healthy and delicious. During room booking it is recommended to consider the breakfast included.
